insults.def_en: Nonsense; something that makes no sense. It's a more colorful way to express disbelief in what someone is saying.
An utterly foolish or senseless person.
A load of rubbish. ex - What a load of  utter balls!
Nonsense or foolish talk. The origins of this term are murky, but it's a wonderfully evocative way to call out baloney.
Something or someone that is suspicious, dishonest, or unreliable.
Someone who talks nonsense or boasts to deceive.
A contemptible person, often used to express disdain or anger towards someone.
This just means devastated, but sounds way better
A foolish or inept person.
Very drunk
A stupid person, foolish, inept.
Shit; trash; rubbish; nonsense.
A foolish or eccentric person.
Extremely tired.
A mistake or failure. ex - I made a right cock-up of that
A Scottish term for someone who's a bit foolish or has done something silly.
Essentially the Irish version of idiot, it's playful and not particularly harsh, often used affectionately to imply someone's being silly
Lacking intelligence, sense, or discernment.
Places emphasis on a comment or another word, it is regarded as a mild expletive.
Someone who takes advantage of situations unethically. It implies a sort of admiration for the person's gall, even while disapproving of their actions.
Used to describe someone who is sulky or whiny. A mardy bum is someone particularly prone to complaining or sulking.
Is used as an alternative to “very” or “extremely.” ex - that's proper mad innit?
Go away; depart
You have got to be joking.
Originally referred to a drunkard (one who tosses back pots of ale) but now means a contemptible or foolish person.
A person who avoids work or responsibility.
A mildly derogatory term for a person, similar to git or bugger.
A stupid or clumsy person.
A gullible person, easily deceived.
A person who avoids work or responsibility.
